You are awoken by dreams of claws rending your flesh and the hiss of radio static.

# BITSY VERSION 3.2

! ROOM_FORMAT 1

POS 3 7,6

DLG a
"Hello? Hello??"

DLG b
You flick the switches. Nothing happens.

DLG c
Static. But mixed in, some sort of...breath. Primal, animal.

DLG d
Is that...purring?

DLG e
Fiddling with the antenna does nothing to clear the signal.

DLG g
The dial flicks between stations. The sound remains indistinct.

DLG h
The small flower is almost wilted.

DLG i
You meant to water it days ago. The leaves are guilting you.

DLG f
Turning off the power does not stop the distant thundering of hooves.

DLG j
Something lurks outside, not bothered by the rain.

DLG n
The picture seems to be breathing.

DLG k
The red rims of the eyes.

DLG o
The moon glows through the rain. Shapes are crawling across it's skin.

DLG p
The phone has no signal. It never has any signal.

DLG q
The mad eyes fill your mind with silence. The beast paws at the air, and charges, hooves flying.

DLG l
The painting needs removing, pulling from the wall, destroying.

DLG m
Is the stag foaming at the mouth? 

DLG r
A hunter watches. Blood rushes to your ears. You can feel the claws in your flesh.

DLG s
Your ears are ringing and you cannot hear your breath. Fangs are piercing.

DLG t
In the blink of an eye the hare of the moon is here, larger than life.

DLG u
One leap will close the distance, one kick will snap your spine.

END 0
The only sound to hear is the thunder of hooves. They crush your bones and turn you to dust. 

END undefined
The moon shines cold and silent as the dream destroys you.

END undefinee


END undefinef
The great white bear roars but you cannot hear it, your skin is torn and blood flows.
